overview: Quarantined at home with his family as the world outside drags toward its end, a young aspiring filmmaker sets out to make the best film ever made. Meanwhile, his physics student brother struggles to fathom the immense concepts of science in order to write his thesis, and his parents struggle with the pressure of family. As his obsessive creative process blurs the line between reality and simulation, films blend together and nightmares take over as the family members begin to lose their sense of identity, reality and time.
tagline: The most boring, pretentious, meaningless, self-indulgent movie you've ever seen!
title: Week Eight
